text.p: Is there an equation [mathjaxinline]y = cx^2 + ax + b,[/mathjaxinline] with [mathjaxinline]c,a,b[/mathjaxinline] all real, satisfied by all four points?

font.p: For a set of parameters [mathjaxinline]c,a,b[/mathjaxinline] to work, we would need the following system of equations to be satisfied:

tr.td: [mathjax]\begin{array}{rcl} 1 & = & c\cdot 0^2 + a\cdot 0 + b \\ 1 & = & c\cdot 1^2 + a\cdot 1 + b \\ 2 & = & c\cdot 2^2 + a\cdot 2 + b \\ 5 & = & c\cdot 3^2 + a\cdot 3 + b \end{array}[/mathjax]

font.p: This is a system of linear equations in [mathjaxinline]c,a,b[/mathjaxinline] given by the augmented matrix
Row-reducing this matrix reveals that the system is inconsistent: there is no such equation satisfied by all four points.
